(US only) | - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - |- |align="left" | "[[We Won't Give In]]" | #121 || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - |- | 1988 |align="left" | "[[Let's Dance (Chris Montez song)|Let's Dance '88]]" | - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - |- |rowspan="2" | 1991 |align="left" | "[[Radio Wall of Sound]]" | #21 || - || - || - || - || #30 || #14 || - || - || - || - |- |align="left" | "[[Universe (Slade song)|Universe]]" | - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - || - |- | colspan="12" style="text-align:center; font-size:8pt;"| "â" denotes a release that did not chart. |} *'''A'''{{Note|note_a1}}"[[Merry Xmas Everybody]]" was annually re-released for most of the eighties in the UK. It charted at #32 in 1981, #67 (1982), #20 (1983), #47 (1984), #48 (1985), #71 (1986). The song next charted at #30 in 1998 in a remixed form credited as 'Slade Vs. Flush'. Since 2006 when UK chart rules changed to allow downloads of old singles eligible to chart the song returned annually. It reached #21 (2006), #20 (2007), #32 (2008), #35 (2009) and #51 (2010) ==Videography== ===Videos=== *''[[Slade in Flame]]'' (1975) *''[[Wall of Hits (video)|Wall of Hits]]'' (1991) *''Inside Slade - The Singles 1971-1991'' (2004) *''The Very Best of Slade'' (2005) *''Slade Alive! - The Ultimate Critical Review'' (2006) ===Music videos=== {| class="wikitable" |- !
